meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be exported.
meanings.sent1: The exportabilities of our products have greatly increased this year.
meanings.sent2: Companies are always looking to improve their exportabilities to reach new customers.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best exportabilities in the market is fierce.
meanings.sent4: Her business acumen lies in understanding the exportabilities of different regions.
meanings.sent5: The success of the trade deal depended on the exportabilities of both parties.

meanings.definition: The potential for goods or services to be sold in foreign markets.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the exportabilities of different countries is crucial for global expansion.
meanings.sent2: The company's exportabilities allowed them to thrive in international trade.
meanings.sent3: The team celebrated the high exportabilities of their latest product launch.
meanings.sent4: The exportabilities of the new technology opened up exciting opportunities for the company.
meanings.sent5: His expertise in assessing exportabilities made him a valuable asset to the team.
